name: Abdul Rahman
bio: Abdul Rahman is a highly skilled Fish Curry specialist with over 10 years of experience in the art of Fish Curry-making. Trained in Dhaka, he uses only the freshest and highest quality ingredients to create beautiful and delicious Fish Curry rolls that are both traditional and innovative. He is known for his precision and attention to detail, and his dedication to his craft is evident in every bite.

recipes.cookingMethod: 1. Marinate chicken with spices. 2. Cook rice. 3. Fry onions and tomatoes. 4. Layer chicken, rice, and fried onions/tomatoes. 5. Cook in a covered pot until chicken is tender.
1. Cook rice. 2. Fry mixed vegetables and garlic. 3. Scramble egg. 4. Add soy sauce and mix everything together. 5. Serve hot.
1. Cook rice. 2. Fry mixed vegetables and garlic. 3. Cook Fish. 4. Add soy sauce and mix everything together. 5. Serve hot.

name: Ayesha Khanam
bio: Ayesha Khanam is a renowned Pitha specialist with over 8 years of experience in the industry. Her passion for baking pitha as a child, and she has since honed her skills to become a master of her craft. Her signature desserts are known for their delicate balance of flavors and textures, and she is always experimenting with new ingredients and techniques to create unique and innovative Pitha. Maria's commitment to quality and attention to detail have earned her a loyal following of Pitha enthusiasts, and she continues to inspire and delight with her delectable creations.

recipes.cookingMethod: 1. Marinate chicken with spices. 2. Cook rice. 3. Fry onions and tomatoes. 4. Layer chicken, rice, and fried onions/tomatoes. 5. Cook in a covered pot until chicken is tender.

1. Mix rice flour and water to form a dough. 2. Knead the dough and form small balls. 3. Press the balls to form flat circles. 4. Steam the circles for 10-15 minutes. 5. Serve hot with curry or chutney.

1. Mix all-purpose flour, semolina, and milk to form a batter. 2. Add grated coconut and jaggery to the batter. 3. Heat a pan and pour a ladleful of batter. 4. Roll the batter into a tube and fold in half. 5. Serve hot or cold.

name: Hasan Khan
bio: Hasan Khan is a Beef Bhuna specialist with over 15 years of experience in the art of smoking and grilling. He has a passion for creating mouth-watering meats that are cooked low and slow over wood-fired pits. He is known for his award-winning Beef Bhuna and his signature Beef sauce, which he makes from scratch using a secret blend of spices. Khan takes pride in his craft and is dedicated to providing his customers with the best beef bhuna experience possible.

ingredients: 1 lb beef, cut into small pieces
recipes.cookingMethod: 1. Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. 2. Add onion, garlic, and ginger. Fry until onion is golden brown. 3. Add beef and fry until it's browned on all sides. 4. Add red chili powder, turmeric powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well. 5. Add 1/2 cup water and cook on low heat until the beef is tender and the water has evaporated. 6. Garnish with cilantro and serve hot with rice or naan.

ingredients: 1 lb beef, cut into small pieces
2 large potatoes, cut into small cubes
recipes.cookingMethod: 1. Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. 2. Add onion, garlic, and ginger. Fry until onion is golden brown. 3. Add beef and fry until it's browned on all sides. 4. Add red chili powder, turmeric powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well. 5. Add 1/2 cup water and simmer on low heat for 20 minutes. 6. Add potatoes and cook until they're soft and the water has evaporated. 7. Garnish with cilantro and serve hot with rice or naan.

ingredients: 1 lb beef, cut into small pieces
recipes.cookingMethod: 1. Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. 2. Add onion, garlic, and ginger. Fry until onion is golden brown. 3. Add beef and fry until it's browned on all sides. 4. Add red chili powder, turmeric powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well. 5. Add 1/2 cup of water and bring it to a boil. Then reduce the heat and let it simmer for 20-25 minutes until the beef is tender and the water has evaporated. 6. Add the frozen peas and cook for an additional 5-7 minutes until the peas are heated through. 7. Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve hot with rice or naan bread.

name: Nafisa Yasmin
bio: Nafisa Yasmin is a highly skilled Shorshe Ilish specialist with over a decade of experience in the culinary industry. She has a deep passion for creating innovative and mouth-watering Shorshe Ilish dishes, using only the freshest and highest quality ingredients. Her expertise ranges from classic favorites like grilled Ilish to exotic dishes like miso-glazed black cod, and she is known for her ability to elevate Shorshe Ilish to new heights. Yasmin is dedicated to sustainable fishing practices and supporting local fishermen, and her commitment to her craft has earned her numerous awards and recognition in the industry.

recipes.cookingMethod:
1. Marinate the fish with turmeric and salt for 10 minutes.
2. Fry the fish in mustard oil until it is golden brown and set aside.
3. Add mustard paste, green chilies, turmeric powder, and water to the same pan.
4. Cook for a few minutes and add the fried fish.
5. Simmer until the sauce thickens.
6. Serve hot with steamed rice.

1. Marinate the fish with turmeric and salt for 10 minutes.
2. Fry the fish in mustard oil until it is golden brown and set aside.
3. Add mustard paste, green chilies, turmeric powder, and water to the same pan.
4. Cook for a few minutes and add the fried fish.
5. Whisk yogurt with some water and add it to the pan.
6. Simmer until the sauce thickens.
7. Serve hot with steamed rice.

1. Marinate the fish with turmeric and salt for 10 minutes.
2. Fry the fish in mustard oil until it is golden brown and set aside.
3. Add mustard paste, green chilies, turmeric powder, and water to the same pan.
4. Cook for a few minutes and add the fried fish.
5. Add coconut milk to the pan and simmer until the sauce thickens.
6. Serve hot with steamed rice.

name: Sumaiya Rahman
bio: Sumaiya Rahman is a highly skilled and passionate Beef Rezala chef who specializes in creating flavorful and super delicious Beef Rezala dishes. She is dedicated to using only the freshest and most sustainable ingredients in her creations, and her innovative approach to Beef Rezala cooking has earned her numerous accolades and a dedicated following. Whether you're a Beef Rezala or simply looking to incorporate more beef-based meals into your list, Sumaiya's dishes are sure to impress.

ingredients: 1 lb beef, cut into small cubes
recipes.cookingMethod:
1. In a bowl, mix the beef, yogurt, ginger paste, and garlic paste. Marinate for 1 hour.
2. In a pan, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the bay leaf and sauté for 1 minute.
3. Add the marinated beef and fry for 5-7 minutes.
4. Add water, sugar, salt, black pepper, cumin powder, coriander powder, cardamom powder, and cinnamon powder. Mix well.
5. Cover and cook for 30 minutes or until the beef is tender.
6. Serve hot with rice or naan.
1. Marinate chicken with spices. 2. Cook rice. 3. Fry onions and tomatoes. 4. Layer chicken, rice, and fried onions/tomatoes. 5. Cook in a covered pot until chicken is tender.

1. Heat oil in a pan and fry the onion, garlic, and ginger until brown. 2. Add beef and fry until brown. 3. Add tomatoes, green chili, cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. 4. Mix well and cook for 10-15 minutes. 5. Add water and cook until the beef is tender. 6. Serve hot with rice or flatbread.

name: Haji Fakruddin
bio: Haji Fakruddin is a renowned Kichuri specialist with a passion for creating delicious and authentic Kichuri dishes. With over 50 years of experience, he has perfected the art of cooking Kichuri using the finest ingredients and traditional methods. His Kichuri is known for its fragrant spices, tender meat, and fluffy rice.

recipes.cookingMethod:
1. Rinse the rice and dal thoroughly and soak in water for 30 minutes. Drain the water and set aside.
2. Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add the onions and fry until golden brown. Add garlic, ginger paste, and green chilies, and sauté for 2-3 minutes.
3. Add the cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, bay leaves, cinnamon sticks, cardamom pods, and cloves. Sauté for 1-2 minutes.
4. Add the rice and dal mixture to the pan and stir well. Add enough water to cover the rice and dal mixture. Add salt to taste.
5. Bring the mixture to a boil. Then reduce heat to low, cover the pan, and simmer for 20-25 minutes or until the rice and dal are cooked.
6. Serve hot with your favorite sides.

1. Rinse the rice and lentils thoroughly and soak in water for 30 minutes. Drain the water and set aside.
2. Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add the onions and fry until golden brown. Add garlic, ginger paste, and green chilies, and sauté for 2-3 minutes.
3. Add the cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, bay leaves, cinnamon sticks, cardamom pods, and cloves. Sauté for 1-2 minutes.
4. Add the diced potatoes, carrots, and cauliflower florets to the pan and stir well. Add the rice and lentils mixture to the pan and stir well. Add enough water to cover the mixture. Add salt to taste.
5. Bring the mixture to a boil. Then reduce heat to low, cover the pan, and simmer for 20-25 minutes or until the rice, lentils, and vegetables are cooked.
6. Serve hot with your favorite sides.
1. Marinate chicken with spices. 2. Cook rice. 3. Fry onions and tomatoes. 4. Layer chicken, rice, and fried onions/tomatoes. 5. Cook in a covered pot until chicken is tender.
